_header: Each man beware that beareth a state
_description: ‘Man knowe thyself loue god & drede’ — twenty-one 8-line stanzas

BodDig102.First Lines:
Eche man be war that bereth astateOf counseil of double
                    entendement…
BodDig102.Last Lines:
…ffle fro fooles & folwe wiseMan knowe thy self loue god
                    & drede
BodDig102.Editions:
Kail,  J.,
                        ed.  
             Twenty-Six Political and Other Poems…from Bodleian MSS Digby 102
                and Douce 322.
EETS
         o.s. 124 (1904; repr. 1973): 1-6.
